alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 25 at 8:46PM PST until February 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2000 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, except up to 8 inches in the high terrain. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 15 inches, except up to 30 inches in the high terrain possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County. This includes Sawyers Bar Road, Etna Summit, and most of Highway 3 and Highway 96. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 4 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 1 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down snow covered tree branches. Snowfall rates of 1 inch per hour and gusty winds will cause significantly reduced visibility and local whiteouts. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
